concept.title: Entry Scale with VSA
concept.shortdesc: This page describes the Entry Scale with VSA model and how to use the configuration files to achieve your cloud deployment goals.

section.title: cloudConfig.yml
section.p: The path to this file is:
Here is the sample file included with the install:
section.codeblock:
--- product: version: 2
cloud: name: helion-entry-scale
# The following values are used when # building hostnames hostname-data: host-prefix: helion member-prefix: -m
# Path to the rest of the input model data-dir: data
# List of ntp servers for your site ntp-servers: # - "ntp-server1" # - "ntp-server2"
# dns resolving configuration for your site # refer to resolv.conf for details on each option dns-settings: # nameservers: # - name-server1 # - name-server2 # - name-server3 # # domain: sub1.example.net # # search: # - sub1.example.net # - sub2.example.net # # sortlist: # - 192.168.160.0/255.255.240.0 # - 192.168.0.0 # # # option flags are '<name>:' to enable, remove to unset # # options with values are '<name>:<value>' to set # # options: # debug: # ndots: 2 # timeout: 30 # attempts: 5 # rotate: # no-check-names: # inet6:
section.p: The key values to enter into this document are the values for your local NTP servers and DNS namesevers.
Your local NTP server(s) would go into this part:
section.codeblock: # List of ntp servers for your site ntp-servers: - "ntp-server1" - "ntp-server2"
section.p: Your local DNS nameserver(s) would go into this part:
section.codeblock: # dns resolving configuration for your site # refer to resolv.conf for details on each option dns-settings: # nameservers: # - name-server1 # - name-server2 # - name-server3
section.note: Ensure that you remove the # tags in front of your nameservers so they are recognized.
